intro: Osmoxylon ramosii, commonly known as the ramose osmoxylon, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
